Class Decoder

java.lang.Object
Decoder
public class Decoder extends Object
The Decoder class creates an object with a certain alphabet and shift amount. The object can then be used to decode a message.

  • Constructor Details

    • Decoder

      public Decoder()
      Constructor for the Decoder class. Default constructor, no parameters. Sets the alphabet to the lowercase english alphabet and sets the shift amount to 1.

    • Decoder

      public Decoder (String alphabet)
      Constructor for the Decoder class. Sets the shift amount to 1.
      Parameters:
      alphabet - represents the special alphabet to use.

    • Decoder

      public Decoder (int shift)
      Constructor for the Decoder class. Sets the alphabet to the the lowercase english alphabet.
      Parameters:
      shift - represents the amount to shift.

    • Decoder

      public Decoder (String alphabet, int shift)
      Constructor for the Decoder class.
      Parameters:
      alphabet - represents the special alphabet to use.
      shift - represents the amount to shift.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString method for the Decoder class
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      returns a string containing the alphabet and shift amount being used surrounded in a border of =

    • decode

      public String decode (String message)
      A method to decode the message. Takes a message parameter and shifts it by the designated shift amount using the specified alphabet.
      Parameters:
      message - Represents the message to decode.
      Returns:
      Returns the decoded message.

    • printDecode

      public void printDecode (String message)
      A method to print the decoded message.
      Parameters:
      message - Represents the message to print.
